greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sequence gives the unique x for each term of A262511 which contains those numbers n that have exactly one solution to x - d(x) = n, where d(n) is the number of divisors of n (A000005).
comment: Sequence is sorted by the magnitude of terms in A262511. Cf. also A262513.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = the least (and the only) such number k > A262511(n) that A049820(k) = A262511(n).
program: (Scheme) (define (A262512 n) (let ((s (A262511 n))) (let loop ((k s)) (if (= s (A049820 k)) k (loop (+ 1 k))))))
xref: Cf. A262513 (same sequence sorted into ascending order).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 25 2015
